section.p: The configuration settings that must be set before deploying are defined in environment variable files that are used by the Docker Compose command for initializing the containers. For details, refer to ### link to deploy container readme ###. They are described in detail below.

section.title: DB_PORT_CORE
section.p: The port of the PostgreSQL database (bss) where the configuration settings for the oscm-core container are stored.
Must be set to 5432.

section.title: DB_PORT_JMS
section.p: The port of the PostgreSQL database (bssjms) where the JMS messages are stored.
Must be set to 5432.

section.title: DB_PORT_APP
section.p: The port of the PostgreSQL database (app) where the configuration settings for the oscm-app container are stored.
Must be set to 5432.

section.title: DB_PWD_CORE
section.p: The password of the user to connect to the bss database.
Default: bssuser

section.title: DB_PWD_APP
section.p: The password of the user to connect to the app database.
Default: ###???

section.title: DB_SUPERPWD
section.p: The password of the PostgreSQL database superuser.
Default: ###???

section.title: SMTP_HOST
section.p: The host name or IP address of your mail server used for notifications by .

section.title: SMTP_PORT
section.p: The port used by your mail server.

section.title: SMTP_FROM
section.p: The email address used for emails sent by .

section.title: SMTP_USER
section.p: If your mail server requires authentication, the name of the user allowed to access the mail server. If no authentication is required, set to none.

section.title: SMTP_PWD
section.p: If your mail server requires authentication, the password of the user allowed to access the mail server. If no authentication is required, set to none.

section.title: SMTP_AUTH
section.p: Defines whether your mail server requires authentication. Can be set to true or false.

section.title: SMTP_TLS
section.p: Defines if TLS (Transport Layer Security) is to be used for mail server communication. Can be set to true or false.

section.title: APP_ADMIN_MAIL_ADDRESS
section.p: The email address used for emails sent by the Asynchronous Provisioning Platform (APP).

section.title: KEY_SECRET
section.p: A string which will be used in the bss database as a seed for encryption and decryption of service parameters with data type PWD and custom attributes marked for encryption. Make sure not to forget this string so that your database is persisted.
section.note: Be aware that you must use the same key when updating the database. Otherwise, encryption and decryption is no longer possible after an update.

section.title: HOST_FQDN
section.p: The fully qualified domain name or the IP address of the host to be used to access .

section.title: REPORT_ENGINEURL
section.p: The URL of the report engine used to generate the platform's reports. If you do not specify a correct URL template, the platform will not be able to generate any reports, since the Report Web service cannot be called correctly.

section.title: TOMEE_DEBUG
section.p: Defines if the application server is to generate log files for the platform. Can be set to true or false.
